etymology.description: Depicts a knife or cutting tool; ⺉ is a variant form of 刀(刀) (dāo, "knife") depicting a dagger or small sword
etymology.interpretation: The shape of ⺉ visually represents a blade or cutting implement, indicating its meaning as 'knife'. This character is a simplified graphic representation of a knife edge.

examples.chinese: 厨师用⺉(廚師用⺉)，切菜切得非常快(切菜切得非常快)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī yòng dāo, qiē cài qiē de fēicháng kuài.
examples.english: The chef uses the knife and cuts the vegetables very quickly.

examples.chinese: 我在厨房找不到⺉(我在廚房找不到⺉)，所以去买了一把⺉(所以去買了一把⺉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài chúfáng zhǎo bù dào dāo, suǒyǐ qù mǎile yì bǎ dāo.
examples.english: I couldn't find the knife in the kitchen, so I went to buy one.
